intro: Oryza sativa var. katayevii, commonly known as the Katayevii rice, is a rare and ancient variety of rice native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its short grain, high amylose content, and distinctive aroma. This variety is often cultivated in wetland environments and is adapted to tropical climates. Its botanical features include slender stalks, small panicles, and pale yellow to brownish spikelets. Due to its genetic uniqueness, it holds significance in agricultural research and conservation efforts.
